Talk to Pajauta.
Defeat Monsters on the Wall
Collect Magnetic Dirt
Pajauta has asked you to collect magnetic dirt in order to create the mark.
Parias Forest Post
Pajauta is waiting for you in Pystis Forest.
Find Traces of the Demons
Find traces of the demons Pajauta mentioned earlier.
Check Mark Locations
Accompany Pajauta to the locations where you will be setting up the marks.
Injured Soldier
Who are you? You shouldn't be here.{nl}The monsters are going to come after the smell of blood.
It's too late for me, I'm injured. You need to save yourself!
Thank you for saving me. I can't believe you took down all those monsters... Who are you?
Oh, you're the Revelator. It's an honor to meet you.{nl}I'm part of the Recovery Squad that's trying to take Barynwell 27 Waters back from the monsters.
I was attacked by the monsters during a recon mission.{nl}I thought I was done for until you appeared. Thank you for saving me.
Agh... The poison is spreading from my wound, I can't move.{nl}Fortunately the water of the lake helps to reduce the monsters' powers.
The parts near the water lilies have a special purifying effect.{nl}If that's okay, would you bring me some lake water from the Old Residential Quarters?
Thank you, Revelator! You can put it inside this bottle.
Go down to the Old Residential Quarters to get some lake water.{nl}The Water Facilities aren't as strong as they were before Medzio Diena, but the water should still have some of the effects.
You're back so soon? Well, you're the Revelator after all.{nl}Thank you. I'll try and get my wound cured before the poison spreads any more.
I used the lake water on my wound, but I still can't move properly.{nl}Will you take this badge and report to my colleagues at the Recovery Squad camp?
Thank you, Revelator! The camp is at the end of the road, up from where we are right now.
I should be safe for a while, now that you took down all the monsters.{nl}The camp is at the end of the road, up from where we are right now.
Recovery Squad Adjutant
We'll be sending a rescue team right away.{nl}Come to think of it, I never really introduced myself. I'm the Adjutant of the Recovery Squad here.
I'm so sorry to bother you on your first visit to the camp, but we're in a desperate situation.{nl}Would you care to listen?

Thank you. I may wear the Schaffenstar uniform, but I am not a member.{nl}I was, once, but I abandoned the Tower with my mentor, who failed to become an Elder at the organization.{nl}My mentor couldn't give up his dream of becoming a Schaffenstar Elder, and he tried desperately to make his name known.
One day, he gathered all of his apprentices and he told us.{nl}He said the Astral Tower, our home, was being attacked by demons... and we needed to get it back.

We had already abandoned the Tower, but we couldn't just stand idly by and watch the demons take over it.{nl}After we arrived in 27 Waters, he told us Lydia Schaffen's lost relic was near.{nl}He said finding the relic would help us defeat the demons.

We started to look for the relic and take down the monsters.{nl}Every day we would fight and search, fight and search.{nl}Even when we were injured, the thought of finding the relic and taking back our home kept us going.
Finally, we found a spot where we thought the relic might be hiding.{nl}Before we could do anything, a giant red portal appeared and demons started pouring from it.
Many of us never made it. Myself and a few others were barely holding on to our lives.{nl}We realized it would be impossible for us to take back the Tower on our own with all those monsters.
But our mentor still believed we had a chance, if only we could find the relic.{nl}He commanded us to carry on with the searches.

Since then, I started to suspect he had wanted us to take over Barynwell to find Schaffen's relic.{nl}I told him multiple times that it was reckless to do anything with the few men we had left.{nl}His answer is always the same: "Aren't you ashamed for the comrades who died for our mission?"
I do want to defeat the demons and take back our home, and avenge the ones who sacrificed themselves for the cause.{nl}It's just... we can't do it on our own.
I know that finding Lydia Schaffen's relic and taking back the Tower is a good, honest cause.{nl}But in our current situation, there's little we can do, realistically.

My colleagues and I managed to convince our mentor to stop the searches and look for the keepsakes of our fallen comrades instead.{nl}Once we have them, we're going to reorganize and ask our old allies for help.
If you were to help us look for the keepsakes, we could make good progress.
I need to call the others first, they're doing a search in Barynwell Hill Road.{nl}Just hold on a minute.
I'm very glad to have a Revelator on our side. That means the goddesses haven't forgotten us yet.{nl}Go up until you reach Barynwell Hill Road.{nl}I'll be preparing us some supplies in the meantime.
My colleagues are searching Barynwell Hill Road.{nl}There'll be monsters there, so be careful.
You're back. I told my colleague to go call our mentor, but no news of them yet.{nl}I guess I'll start by talking to the ones that just arrived.
They aren't happy with the plan, are they? I understand...{nl}Our mentor always takes us to safe spots for the searches, after we take care of the monsters.
Even when the demon portal appeared... I'm sorry. I'm talking too much.{nl}I'll tell you next time.
After the portal appeared in the Collapsed Square, the area has been teeming with monsters.{nl}There's no way we can take it back all by ourselves.
I think we need to reduce their numbers before we try to destroy the portal.{nl}The plan is to set up a trap and lure the monsters away. Will you help us install the trap?
We can't receive external help, so our resources are scarce. This is our last chance to do anything.{nl}Let's make sure we succeed.
Go ahead and set up the bombs near the alleyway to the Collapsed Square.
I'm glad we got the bomb setup out of the way.{nl}Now we just need to lure the monsters in.
I was keeping an eye on the monsters while you set up the bombs.{nl}Can you wait by the marked spot near the alleyway?{nl}Let me know when you're ready so I can lure in the monsters.
Are you ready? Okay, I'll lure the monsters in now.{nl}Go to the location and wait there.
Looking at the portal reminds me of all the comrades we lost.
The operation was risky, we were ready for the worst. Luckily with you here, everything worked out better than expected.{nl}Thank you for doing right by our comrades.
We need to destroy the portal before any more monsters can come through.{nl}But I think the explosion earlier may have attracted monsters from other areas.
We'll get ready to block the alleyways.{nl}You go and take down the portal at the Collapsed Square!
The portal is in the middle of the Collapsed Square.{nl}Be careful, there could be monsters in the area.

Great job taking down the portal. We can finally look for our comrades' keepsakes.{nl}Also... our mentor is back and he wants to talk to you in private.{nl}I'll be setting up things so we can start searching the Old Concert Hall area in the meantime.
Recovery Squad Leader
Ah. Welcome, Revelator. I heard news of you arriving during my search. As you know, we're looking for the relic that will let us take over the Barynwell areas.
My students told me you helped them take down the demons. We are very grateful.{nl}As their mentor, I apologize for letting them pull you into all this trouble.
That said, if you do agree to help us, finding the relic will only be a matter of time.
Only then, of course, will we be able to finally take back our land.{nl}We couldn't possibly face off that many monsters with such low numbers otherwise.

I know my students must have complained to you about what's been happening.{nl}But now that the portal is destroyed, we can finally search the Old Concert Hall.{nl}That's the only area we haven't searched yet. I'm certain that the relic will be there.
I gave out orders to begin the search there already. Please, have some rest before you join us. I understand you just went through a difficult battle.
I know my students must have complained to you about me.{nl}Too many of us died when that portal appeared and the monsters attacked.
After that day, I knew the rest of us wouldn't survive if we were to face the monsters again.{nl}Our only chance to take back the Barynwell regions was to find Schaffen's relic once and for all.

Why didn't we receive external aid, you mean?{nl}Hmm... We did try to request it, but to no avail...{nl}After Medzio Diena, people can barely look after themselves, let alone help a group of strangers.
My students must be starting the search at the Old Concert Hall soon.{nl}Go ahead and join them there.

You're back. We managed to find our colleagues' keepsakes in the meantime. Thank you for the help, really.{nl}We also found a hidden location in the Old Concert Hall.{nl}Let me show you what was inside. This is...{nl}
Hm? Do you feel that shaking? What's happening?
That was a nasty monster... I don't know what we would've done without you.
You know, after Medzio Diena I often thought this was it, this is the end.{nl}But seeing you now, it gives me hope for the future.
Brockal Himil
It's rare seeing someone make it here without a scratch. Are you perhaps a Revelator?
What an honor to finally meet one of the Revelators.{nl}My name is Brockal Himil. I was sent from the Himil family to help take back the Maven areas.
Sorry if I'm being too brazen, but I could really use the help of someone like you.{nl}Would you care to give us a hand?
Our local defense systems are damaged because of a monster attack we had.{nl}Before I explain, let me get out the orders to start repairing the stockades.
Thank you. I'm glad you are as kind as you are talented.
It's an honor to have you on our side.{nl}The damaged stockades are at the camp alleyway.
We wouldn't have gotten our defense back up so quickly without you. Thanks.
It's been a long time since family, the Himils, abandoned the Astral Tower.{nl}Yet, we couldn't stay still and watch it being taken over by the monsters. We needed to act.
This region here connects to District 13 of the Outer Wall.{nl}If we can't block the monsters here, many people will be in danger.
Maven 31 Waters, on the other hand, connects to the Outer Wall as well as two Water regions.{nl}Even if we take down all the monsters in one area, it won't be easy to cover all the regions.
I do think it will be long before our defense operation here is over.{nl}We're still receiving external aid, but we needed to find local resources as well.
Fortunately, we now know that the nearest reservoir is not contaminated.{nl}I'm going to send out a few of our soldiers to secure food supplies, would you mind waiting?
Are you sure? That's... very kind of you, thank you. To tell you the truth, many of our soldiers were injured in the last battle.{nl}I'm glad you're here to help.
The reservoir is to the right.{nl}There are still monsters around, but the lake water is clean... It seems the Water Facilities there are still working.
You're done already? Well, you really can't beat experience, can you?{nl}I'm honestly impressed, Revelator.

Our scouts found some suspicious monster movement in the Old Training Grounds near the camp.{nl}I don't know if we can stand another attack, if that's what they're planning.{nl}This time we need to hit them first.
Let's go take down the monsters at the Old Training Grounds!
With you on our side, I'm sure victory will be ours.{nl}But of course, anything can happen in a battle.{nl}I'll make sure my soldiers are aware of that and don't lose their focus.
Thank you for your service. The last battle was hard on us, many were injured during the conflict.{nl}This time you truly gave us the upper hand.
Before you arrived, we had other confrontations with the monsters. Each one left several of our soldiers injured.{nl}The problem is that they keep coming, while our forces grow weaker and weaker.
The soldiers' morale is lower than ever.{nl}Do you think you can help lift their spirits a little?
I believe a hero like yourself can be a great influence on our forces.
The atmosphere is completely different with you here, I can already feel it.
Another reason we weren't doing so well is the new monster that has arrived recently.{nl}Not only is it strong, it's also very clever. We don't know what to do about it.

I was going to put together a squad to take it down, but we're short on manpower. Right now we have a single student keeping an eye on the monsters at the Collapsed Shelter.{nl}Would you care to help him?

Thank you, Revelator. I sent him a carrier pigeon earlier, so he should know you're coming.{nl}To get to the Collapsed Shelter, just go up this way and take a left before you reach the entrance to the Observatory.
We'll be repairing our damaged equipment in the meantime.{nl}We can get ready to attack as soon as we're done.
Brockal Himil's Apprentice
Revelator! Hello! I'm a student of Mr. Brockal Himil, the one who's investigating the monsters.{nl}Mr. Himil told me you helped our forces back at the camp.
My student is still learning, but he's a fine warrior.{nl}Still, as his mentor, I'm worried about him being on his own.{nl}He's at the Collapsed Shelter investigating the new monsters.

When we first arrived, the monsters looked like they were just acting by instinct.{nl}With a little strategy we were able to overpower them, even despite their large numbers.{nl}Recently, however, they've started to make formations and ambush our forces.
We've found that, ever since this new monster appeared, it seems to be commanding the others.{nl}That's why I came out to observe their behavior.

These monsters started acting very differently after the "leaders" arrived.{nl}They're no longer territorial, and instead have started to form their own social groups.{nl}That's how they make up for each other's weaknesses.

Now they'll hide in the water plants and ambush our soldiers, or they'll wait for night time to attack.{nl}They're getting more and more dangerous, which is why our mentor tried to take down the leader.{nl}What we didn't know was that this leader is a lot more powerful than the other monsters.
Not only that, the leader is always surrounded by other monsters.{nl}If we're going to take it down, first we need to get rid of the minions.
We know it's a dangerous task, but you're the only one we can count on.
Thank you, Revelator!{nl}You can take care of the monsters at Maven Intersection while I look out for the leader.

Mr. Himil was injured in the last battle while he was trying to protect me.{nl}He never complained, he simply kept going until the end.{nl}Having a mentor like this really makes me want to work hard to defeat these monsters.
I never knew you were so strong.{nl}With you around, we're that much closer to finally getting rid of all evil energy in the region.
Unfortunately there are a lot more monsters around now.{nl}If you're going to fight the leader, you need to preserve your power.

We believe there's a device located around the Maven lake area that can fight off the monsters.{nl}But ever since we arrived, we've had our hands so full with all these monsters that we haven't been able to check.
We think this device could be very useful to us, but it's hard to tell how long that would take.{nl}So, for now, we're going to use a set of bombs.
Thank you, Revelator. I'll go and set up some bombs at Maven Intersection.{nl}You can do the same around the Collapsed Observatory.
I'm going to install the bombs and keep an eye on the monsters.
The bombs are all set. Time to lure in the monsters.
I'm going to lure in the remaining monsters.{nl}You can wait by the Collapsed Observatory and take down any monsters that survive the explosion.
After we get rid of these monsters, we need to report back to our mentor and get ready to fight the leader.{nl}I really hope we make it this time.
The leader appeared all of a sudden when I was luring in the monsters.{nl}I managed to defend myself from the attack, but I think my arm is broken.
I probably would be even worse off if it weren't for you.{nl}That monster's clever, it must have figured out what I was up to.{nl}It don't think it saw you, at least.
I can't believe you took down that monster before I could even send out a carrier pigeon...{nl}You really are something special. I admire you.
That was close, I'm glad you were around to help me. Let's report back to Mr. Himil.
Revelator! We heard a monster, I was just about to gather our forces. What on earth just happened?
I have never seen anyone take down such a powerful monster, you really are something else.
I'm still amazed that you took down the leader on your own.{nl}And thank you for saving my student. We're really fortunate to have you here.
That lead monster was our biggest obstacle so far.{nl}I never thought we would take it down without some serious sacrifice.{nl}I can't believe you did it so easily...
Now it's only a matter of time until we get rid of the other monsters.{nl}I wish we could hold on to you a little longer, but I know you'll be needed somewhere else.
I know the Lakers that took care of these regions are having an especially hard time right now.{nl}I don't think they were trained in combat yet.
If you ever meet the Lakers, do help them out like you did to us.{nl}I'll pray that your journey will always be blessed by the goddesses.
{nl}From now on, I swear to protect this region with my own life.
Garrison
Thank you. I was so nervous, I'm glad you were here to help.
Thank you, Revelator! I'll protect this lake with my own life.
I was so afraid all this time... But no more.
I know we're going to win this battle with you.{nl}I'm never going to give up.
Laker Boy
Hi there. Are you a traveler?{nl}Be careful around here, this place has been full of monsters and water plants since Medzio Diena.
A Revelator... oh, you're the Revelator! I guess I was worried for nothing, then.{nl}I heard that you help people you are in trouble... Can you help me too?

Oh, thank you! Ever since Medzio Diena, the water plants around here have been growing bigger and faster.{nl}It's been getting harder and harder for me to take care of the lake.{nl}Would you help me get rid of the water plants around the watch post?
Anyone who wants to become a Schaffenstar has to clean out the water plants.{nl}I'm gonna work hard at the lake, and hopefully one day I'll go live in the Astral Tower.
Wow, you're great at getting rid of those heavy water plants! I can't even pick them up.{nl}If I become a member of the Schaffenstar, will I be strong like you?
To process the water plants, we need to use the machine inside the water point control room.{nl}Usually we hide it away so the monsters don't find it.
I'm gonna go first and get the machine ready.{nl}Meanwhile, can you move the water plants we got from the lake?
You don't have to move all of them! Just take some and I'll do the rest.
You moved all of them? Wow, that was enough work for half a day... Thank you.{nl}Now let me show you how to process the plants with the machine.
Um, Revelator... We have a problem. I never tried to process this many plants...{nl}I don't think my magic source is gonna be enough.{nl}I'm gonna get some more magic sources. You just wait here.
What? You wanna help? But you already helped me move the plants... Thank you!{nl}You can find some magic sources at the Old Warehouse. They're like shiny stones, you'll see them right away.
You're so friendly, Revelator.{nl}I wanna be a nice member of the Schaffenstar and help other people like you do.
Wow, that's a lot of magic sources!{nl}I'm not gonna have to worry about them for a while now.{nl}Thank you!
You helped go through so many water plants, thank you!{nl}If that's okay, will you help our leader at the Laker Temporary Base too?
She's the only one who can fight in the whole area of Maven 32 Waters...{nl}She's having a hard time right now because of all the monsters.
I wish I could help her fight off the monsters too... but I don't know how.{nl}I bet you could help her do that, though!
Laker Leader
Welcome. I'm the Laker Leader in charge of this region.{nl}Before I say anything else, I believe I owe you an apology.
You see, I've been watching you ever since you arrived in the area. I had to know who you were.{nl}I was ready to attack you if I saw anything that looked suspicious.
But you were different from what I expected. I saw how you helped the boy.{nl}Thank you for that.
The leader is always watching over this area.{nl}One time she saved me and my sister when a monster appeared.
When I grow up, I wanna be a member of the Schaffenstar and help the Laker Leader!{nl}I think she's at the Laker Temporary Base right now.
But I wonder... not many people manage to get through all the monsters out there...{nl}You don't look like an ordinary traveler... so what are you doing here, exactly?
I see. You're a Revelator. I'm sorry for being so suspicious.{nl}Most of us Lakers come from villages around the lake.

Our people have been taking care of this lake for more than 600 years, ever since Lydia Schaffen founded the Astral Tower.{nl}I, too, grew up taking care of the water plants, dreaming of one day joining the Schaffenstar.{nl}That is, until that tragic day that changed everything.
After Medzio Diena, the plants started to grow bigger and bigger.{nl}But we never gave up. We carried on taking care of the lake, and we managed to keep the plants under control.
So... we can handle the plants now, but the monsters are another story.{nl}I learned how to fight from a mentor who's no longer with us.{nl}But most of the Lakers were never trained in combat.

We're seeing more and more monsters around, to the point where it's hard for us to handle them.{nl}There's also a giant monster that's encroaching on our working areas. We can barely get to the water plants anymore.{nl}Will you please help us?
Thank you!
I've tried several times to take down the giant monster myself, but there's little I can do on my own.{nl}The most I could do was feed it some bait with tranquilizers to knock it down for a while.
Before you arrived, I was crafting some poison arrows to use on the monster.{nl}Can I ask you to get me some Plants with Lake Energy from the Old Stakeout Box?
I'll be collecting the other materials and keeping an eye on the monster meanwhile.

I learned how to make poison from my mentor. They're a famous hunter, you see.{nl}They had to leave because of something, but they should be back someday.{nl}And be careful, the Old Stakeout Box is still full of monsters.
Great. I hope the monsters didn't give you too hard of a time out there.{nl}The giant one is still knocked out from the spiked bait. We should get going before it wakes up.
Fighting this giant monster is going to attract other monsters in the area.{nl}Worst case scenario, these monsters can make the whole situation turn against us.
The giant monster is asleep in the alleyway to the Old Laker Training Grounds.{nl}Would you clear out the monsters there while I finish the poison arrows?
My mentor taught me to always hunt with caution.{nl}It's important to get rid of any uncertainties.
Please get rid of a few monsters around the area.{nl}I'll go and help you as soon as I'm done with these arrows.
That was fast. I've just finished the poison, too.
Time to take care of that giant monster. Sigh... I'm a little nervous.{nl}I'll be counting on you for this.
I know you got rid of the monsters in the area, but you never know when the ones from other regions are going to come running.{nl}We should get going now.
I'll head to the Old Laker Training Grounds first and keep an eye on the giant.{nl}Just come over to the alleyway when you're ready.
Glad to see you're safe, Revelator. I'm sorry I couldn't help.{nl}I don't know what would happen to me if you weren't around.{nl}
I thought my training was done after my mentor left, but I guess not.{nl}Thank you so much for your help.{nl}
Uhh... this wound's more serious than I thought. I need to have it checked back at the camp.{nl}I'm really sorry, Revelator, but there's one more favor I want to ask of you.

The giant monster may be gone now, but our problems at the lake are far from over.{nl}Young lakers like the Laker Boy need self-defense weapons, but to make them we need a material that can only be obtained from monsters.
I would hunt the monsters myself, but in this state, there isn't much I can do.{nl}Would you hunt down the Frocoli at the Laker Shelter and get the materials for me instead?
The material we need comes from the Frocoli monsters that live in the Laker Shelter.{nl}I know you must be tired from the battle with the giant monster, I'm very sorry.{nl}{nl}
You got the materials. Great.{nl}This should keep us safe for a while. But of course,  we'll need to be on the lookout for any new threats.
Thank you for all your good work here.{nl}I know we can't always depend on the help of people like you.{nl}This is our land, and we need to be strong enough to defend it ourselves.
I hope we'll finally become strong enough to defend our land by the next time you see us.{nl}May your journey always be blessed by the goddesses.

I know we received a lot of help from you, but it was an honor to fight by your side, Revelator.{nl}I wonder if this is how the old Lakers felt when they helped Lydia Schaffen protect the Astral Tower.{nl}I hope we can be of help to you next time you see us.
When I become a member of the Schaffenstar, I'm gonna be like you and the Laker Leader and help people who need me!
The Outer Wall was the area most affected by Medzio Diena.{nl}If the monsters start crossing over into the region... Well, we can't let that happen.
We're fighting these monsters every day.{nl}But no matter how many we take down, their numbers stay the same. It's honestly making me lose hope.
The monsters are multiplying as we speak.{nl}What's going to be of us?
The borders are safe for now, but the monsters have been acting strange recently.{nl}I really don't know what to do...
After we take back the Maven region, I'm going to go back and propose to my best friend.{nl}Do you think we'll be alright after this?
The monsters could still try another attack here.{nl}It's best if we go back to the camp.
We'll... take care of the body.
I did have my qualms about Mr. Himil, but deep down I really trusted him.{nl}When he first stepped up as our leader, he was a really honorable man. I don't know what made him change like that...
Also, the object we found wasn't Lydia Schaffen's relic.{nl}We're not sure what it is, but it seems to be an important part of the Water Facility.

It didn't break even after that giant monster stepped on it, which makes us think it's a very special object.{nl}It may not be the relic, but we believe we can use it to reinforce the area's defensive system.

First, our forces need some time to reorganize. We're exhausted, both mentally and physically.{nl}We'll prepare for battle later.{nl}We still need to find out where and how to use the piece, so I might need to contact some former colleagues...
Come to think of it, Mr. Himil did act a little strange.
After the portal appeared in the Collapsed Square, we were looking to escape to the Maven 31 Waters region.

But if that region was already taken over by monsters, we would end up completely stranded.{nl}I suggested that we investigate the Barynwell Lot and Maven 31 Waters in advance to make sure.{nl}Mr. Himil, however, insisted that he take charge of the Barynwell Lot himself. He wouldn't even let us go near it.

He said he had already investigated the area and drawn out an escape route, that it would be a waste of time for us to go there.{nl}I can't be sure, but I believe there's something in Maven 31 Waters he was trying to hide from us.
Thanks again for your help, Revelator.{nl}We finally avenged our comrades' sacrifice, and we may not have the relic, but this Water Facility piece will be very useful.
Next time you come by, I hope you can finally see the lake restored to its old glory.
I don't know who you are, but you need to run away! There are monsters out there waiting to attack.

I'm too young to remember, but they say the plants weren't big like this before Medzio Diena!{nl}I guess cleaning out the plants wasn't as hard back then.{nl}By the way, you should get going now. There's monsters all over this place.
Tiger Hunter Master
Dirty creatures...{nl}You just wait...{nl}I'm gonna...
Beasts and people both leave traces wherever they go.{nl}When you hunt, you need to hide yourself and wait for the prey to let its guard down.{nl}Then, you finish it off in one blow.
{nl}Otherwise, you may end up becoming the prey yourself.{nl}Like the people in my village...
Kedoran Alliance Tadas
You're not just a regular traveler, are you?{nl}No one in their right mind comes up here, not even the adventurous ones...{nl}And I heard from the Alliance there's Revelator in the area.

{nl}They sent me here to gather the remains of the Outer Wall.{nl}I brought two other people to help me out at first but...{nl}All they do is fight, so I got no one helping me right now.{nl}Say, would you give me a hand?
Heya.{nl}These are the two helpers I told you about.{nl}They're both stubborn as mules, and they haven't stopped fighting since we got here.
{nl}We should be wrapping up things here so we can go back, but with those two it's impossible.
I can't do anything the Alliance is asking me.{nl}Would you go out to the Watchman's Post and get some Yellow Fragments instead?{nl}I'm really sorry, kid...
I'll try and convince those two meanwhile.
The nerve of those kids, not listening to their own boss...!{nl}I really don't know what to do with them.
I told them they were dismissed, that you were taking care of things.{nl}As soon as I tell them that, they go right after you!
{nl}Can you believe this...?
I mean, I know you're a famous Revelator and all.{nl}I reckon they just want a chance to work with you.
{nl}But it's complicated, you know? I can't let them do that.{nl}Would you please just try and convince them?{nl}They should listen to you at least, right?
The situation's tricky, you see.{nl}Nergui was born in Mors, but she was raised in the Alliance.{nl}And for some reason she doesn't seem to trust Wolke.
{nl}I don't wanna send out the both of them with you, that'd be too much trouble.{nl}Would you take care of Wolke first?{nl}Thanks.
Barbarian Wolke
Excellent choice!{nl}Alright, my time to shine.{nl}First things first, we head over to the Collapsed Assembly Area and take everyone down!
{nl}Oh, right. The Master asked me to do something else first.{nl}You go ahead and get started.{nl}I'll just go talk to Tadas and I'll join you after that.
It's me or the enemy!{nl}One of us has to die.
All done.{nl}You're gutsier than you look, huh!
{nl}He wants us to go up to the Northern Tournament Hall.{nl}We're supposed to get Shiny Glass Shards from the monsters there.
{nl}Go ahead if you're ready.
Tadas told me you're a busy Revelator.{nl}How about you get going to the Northern Tournament Hall?
That's a lotta Glass Shards right there.{nl}Not bad!
There's a lot of stuff here you can't find in regular walls.{nl}Relics with the energy of the goddesses, things you'd see at a church...{nl}I wonder what the Alliance is gonna do with all of this.
I heard something interesting when I was back with the Alliance.{nl}They told me the Kedora Merchant Alliance was a thing even before the Capital.{nl}Apparently they're the ones who built this wall.
{nl}I mean, a single organization building something this big...{nl}I've been with them for decades now, but I still wonder if they're really just a normal merchant guild.
{nl}This time I'd like you to go get some Cornerstone Pieces with Nergui.{nl}They said you could find some at the Weapons Assembly Area.
Kedora Alliance Nergui
I'm all about safety first, okay?{nl}Just keep that in mind if you're coming with me.
This oughta do it.{nl}I guess the Alliance always knows how to find these things...{nl}Secrets a low member like me can't even dream of.
And the cornerstones were dragged all the way to the top of the wall...{nl}Isn't that weird?{nl}I thought it was a joke when the Alliance told me to come get them.
Think about it.{nl}These cornerstones are supposed to be under the ground.{nl}They're there to support the wall, doesn't make sense to have them on top.
That tree root over there is all over the wall, how come the wall didn't just crumble?{nl}Just how deep... and how strong is it?
{nl}I sent them each on a different task earlier. Can I have a word with you in the meantime?

I think the Alliance is gonna try to either restore the wall or take anything of value and then sell it.{nl}The problem is that tree root.{nl}They can't just cut it off, the whole wall could crumble to the ground if they do.
{nl}So I wanna find out just how strong this root is.{nl}Can you help me out with that?{nl}I can't trust the other two to do this right...
Say, you ever thought about quitting that Revelator life and working for me?
{nl}If not, alright, I guess...
This thing is heavy as an anvil...
{nl}I should find the other two and send them back to headquarters now.{nl}Couldn't get anything done around here if it weren't for you.{nl}Thanks a lot, kid.
Kedora Alliance Ineta
I should just quit the Alliance already...
{nl}Oh! Um, hi. Are you exploring around here?
{nl}Huh? Oh! You're that Revelator they talked about at the Alliance!{nl}Listen, I need you to save- I mean help me!
Maybe I should just run away...
{nl}Oh! That was nothing.
That's odd.{nl}When I used it, all I saw were merchants...{nl}Who is that woman?
How about this?{nl}You're curious about it too, aren't you?{nl}I'll let you borrow it if you do me a favor. Hm?
{nl}It's nothing big...{nl}I just want you to walk with it and bring me any objects that react to it.
Sigh... Maybe I should really run away now.
{nl}Oh! You're still here?!
Woah... that's a lot.{nl}How did you carry all of this stuff?{nl}Can you carry the things and take them to Fedimian?
{nl}What? You can't?{nl}Hm, okay...
{nl}What's that pendant, though?
I've never seen it before.{nl}We should take an image of it with the Time Meter.
Go ahead, use it!
I'm from the south coast, so I never went through what the refugees did after Medzio Diena.{nl}But I hope the person in this image can be happy again.
Oh, thank the goddesses, my prayers have been answered!{nl}Will you come over to the Barrack Roof, then?{nl}There's something else I need you to do there.
I thought I'd be done here after a couple of days...{nl}I can't believe we have so much left to do...
The name Pajauta is written on the back of the pendant.{nl}Do you think it could be the woman from the image?{nl}Hm... Who could she be?
Where...
{nl}Where did you get this?
{nl}No, I won't ask anymore.{nl}Just know that this is a memory I wish I could forget.
I don't know who this person is but...{nl}Please make sure they're well if you find them.
Just take this!

I'm a Chronomancer, dispatched here by the Alliance.{nl}I was asked to investigate the events of Medzio Diena, but all they gave me was this necklace...{nl}They didn't tell me what to do with it.{nl}But I can't go beyond that bridge.{nl}The monsters would kill me!
{nl}So please, would you help me?{nl}I want you to use this and check for any images in the area.
Schaffenstar Adjutant Apollonius
If you're trying to pass through, I would advise you not to.{nl}No, I cannot let you pass. The path ahead is far too dangerous.
You're... awfully powerful.{nl}You don't seem like an ordinary outsider. May I ask who you are?{nl}
A Revelator? You're the one I've been hearing about. I never thought I'd see the day!{nl}Is this the will of Laima...?{nl}
I'm so sorry for the sudden request, but we're in desperate need of assistance.{nl}It wasn't my intention to grab a hold of you like this, but will you listen to our plight?
Allow me to introduce myself. I am Adjutant Apollonius, of the Schaffenstar.{nl}I'm in charge of protecting this area.{nl}
This region is very important, you see, as it connects the Astral Tower to the Kingdom territories.{nl}That is why it has been protected from the demons since the beginning.{nl}
One day, we heard rumors that our leader Ignas had made a pact with the demons himself.{nl}We didn't think that was possible, it was hard for us to believe in it.{nl}

Then recently, this area began to attract more and more demons, and soon enough our supplies had been cut off.{nl}Then the Tower superiors stopped paying attention to this region, and we knew the rumors were true.{nl}
We were appalled. But we couldn't dare to abandon such a strategic location.{nl}We knew that if we tried, it would only cause the death of innocent people.{nl}
But now... we're at our limit. We're exhausted, and soon we'll be running out of supplies.{nl}We had our minds set, we wanted to endure this for as long as we could.{nl}
And then you came.{nl}You're the only one who can turn this situation around, you... you're here now.{nl}
So I ask again: will you please help us?{nl}
We need your power and the help of the Resistance forces to overcome this once and for all.{nl}Please, help us...
Thank you! Oh, thank you!{nl}Thank Goddess Laima for leading you to us.{nl}
Allow me to explain our plan.{nl}
Just come to me when you are ready.
Our goal is to get the most efficacy with the least damage taken.{nl}Many of our soldiers are tired and injured, you see.{nl}
Receiving material aid and manpower from the Resistance's side will be very important.{nl}But we also need to prepare for any incoming threats.
We've managed to obtain the demons' battle instructions before. That is how we have been able to resist their attacks.{nl}I have studied the demon language, so I can read their documents.{nl}
The instructions have been very helpful in telling us when the demons might attack.{nl}We would like to try the same method this time.{nl}
See whether you can find battle instructions or other documents from monsters in the area.{nl}The more, the better. Can we count on you for that?
I learned the demon language from a bishop who had lived in my hometown since before the Schaffenstar.{nl}He was a very generous and considerate man.
Thank you! I'll get to analyzing these documents right away.{nl}In the meantime, there's something else I'd like you to do.
These written documents are always very useful, but they don't tell us everything we need to know.{nl}Word of mouth is often just as important.{nl}
I would like us to try and hear from the demons themselves, and see what it is that they are planning.{nl}For that, we will need to disguise ourselves as demons.{nl}
The Druid Master is rather gifted with transformation, or so I've heard.{nl}Would you mind asking her if there is a way to disguise ourselves as demons?{nl}
You know our situation now. I trust you to handle it with utmost care.
Huh? You want to turn into demons?{nl}Why would you do that?{nl}
Oh, I see...{nl}I'll let you have this, then. It's a transformation potion.{nl}
I developed the solution myself.{nl}It's still in the testing stages, but I can guarantee you it works.{nl}
All you have to do is think of the demon you last saw, then drink this to take its form.{nl}I hope it's useful to the people you're trying to help. Alright, go ahead then.
I do hope the Druid Master can help us...
Do you mean we can turn into demons with this potion?{nl}The last demon I saw...{nl}
In that case, I believe we should disguise ourselves as Banterers. They're the leaders around here.{nl}It should be easier to obtain the information we need that way.
I really hope my potion can help you.{nl}Oh, if you can, do tell me how the transformation went after you take the potion. For my research, you know.
Very well, it's time to use the potion.{nl}Make sure you take the form of a Banterer and collect any information you can from the monsters.{nl}
Report back to me when you're done.{nl}Is that alright?
I realize it's a dangerous tactic, but I do think it's the best way we have to investigate the enemy.{nl}We're counting on you.
Oh, you're back.{nl}I've just finished collecting all the instructions and informing to the soldiers.{nl}What did you find?{nl}
Are you saying...? They're summoning a Banshee Boss?{nl}They're going to try and end us once and for all...!{nl}
There's no time to waste.{nl}We must tell the others about this.
Hurry and inform the soldier over to my left.{nl}They'll be quick to alert the rest of the forces.{nl}
Then, go and see Resistance Adjutant Benjaminas in Barynwell 85 Waters.{nl}He's an old colleague of mine.{nl}
He has worked here before, I'm sure he'll be willing to help us.{nl}I'll gather the soldiers and prepare our defenses in the meantime. Now go.
This is a matter of life and death. This attack could threaten the lives of our entire forces.{nl}We have no choice but to win. We must. For our own sake.
Resistance Adjutant Benjaminas
Revelator?{nl}What are you...?{nl}
What? No, it can't be...{nl}If they fall, the Astral Tower and everything around it will be in danger!{nl}
Thank you for the report. He did a great job holding on for so long...{nl}We'll be glad to help in any way we can.{nl}
I'll inform our commander and gather the soldiers immediately.{nl}If the monsters attack before we arrive, please make sure they stay safe until we arrive. We'll be there as soon as possible.
What did he say? Will they help us?{nl}
I see... That's good to hear. We only need to resist the attack until they arrive.{nl}Thank you, Revelator. This is all thanks to you.{nl}
All that's left to do is face the demons.{nl}This could very well become our last battle. Would you... be willing to join us?
If you hadn't found us... we wouldn't have made it alive for much longer.{nl}Our soldiers are tired and injured, dealing with the constant threat of demon attacks.{nl}
And yet we endured all that. We survived.{nl}All thanks to you and our comrades at the Resistance forces.{nl}
Thank you, Revelator. Thank you for helping us protect our land.{nl}All we need now is for the Resistance to continue offering their help to keep it safe.{nl}
Myself, I ought to tend to our injured soldiers before returning to oversee the region.{nl}You can rest assured that it will be safe now.{nl}
Go, Revelator. Find our goddess' Revelations and save this world from chaos.{nl}We are all counting on you.
Wounded Soldier Spirit
Run... It's too dangerous... out here...{nl}They're coming... Please, hurry...
You're... powerful...{nl}Thank you for saving me...
Royal Soldier Spirit
I feel a lot better now. Thanks again for helping me.{nl}But I think the wave's already started to spread now.{nl}
All the other demons in the area are going to come rushing in.{nl}I don't even know if they're really demons. They could have been good spirits...{nl}
A long time ago this land was cursed with a strange type of evil energy.{nl}That energy had always been dormant because of the Divine Tree.{nl}

But as you know, during Medzio Diena the Divine Tree grew out of control, and the evil curse was released.{nl}The strange energy started to spread, tearing away at people, demons, and all the creatures that lived here.{nl}

Anyone caught in the curse would eventually go mad and become like a slave to this evil energy.{nl}I was running away from the energy too, trying to escape the curse, but as you saw... it's dangerous out here.{nl}
If it weren't for you I'd be...{nl}Who... are you, by the way? You don't seem too affected by the energy.{nl}
You're a Revelator? I see... That means...{nl}If anyone can save this place from the curse, it's you.{nl}
I can't do it on my own.{nl}We need to stop this evil energy and save the people who are suffering from it. Will you help me?
Thank you, really.{nl}I want to find a way to stop this evil energy, even if we can't use the power of the Divine Tree.{nl}
We also need to find out how to cure the ones who are under the curse.{nl}The problem is I'm tied down here, I can't move.{nl}
Would you find someone who can help us instead?{nl}I'm sure someone in the Kingdom can give us a solution.
We should try the Taoist Master first. Please ask him if there's anything we can do.
Yes, I've heard a lot about that curse.{nl}But I'm afraid I can't clear out the evil energy there all by myself.{nl}
What I can do is help you release those who are under the curse.{nl}
Let me give you some of my Purifiers.{nl}If you find anything that's spreading the evil energy, simply stick one of these sheets on it.{nl}
That should help clear out the area a little.{nl}Also, you might want to speak with the Exorcist Master. He should know more about this than me.{nl}
Would you go and ask him?{nl}I'm sure there's something he can tell you.
The Taoist Master wants me to see the Exorcist Master.{nl}I should go find him.
You should go and see the Exorcist Master.{nl}I'm sure he'll be able to help you.
If only we can stop this energy...{nl}It would make everything better...
Oh, how I feel the pain of those poor souls.{nl}We are well aware of the terrible energy that's cursing that land.{nl}
If you want to eliminate the energy once and for all, you'll first need to find its origin.{nl}That, of course, is no easy task. But if you're willing to try, I can give you these.{nl}

This one is Purifying Holy Water. You may spray it on the victims after the curse is removed to cleanse their spirit.{nl}This one is a small Goddess Sculpture I received from the Dievdirbys Master.{nl}
This sculpture has the power of the Dievdirbys Master and myself combined.{nl}I want you to place it on the spot where the energy is coming from.{nl}
The sculpture will help suppress the evil energy and stop it from spreading.
You're back. What did you find?{nl}
I see. I think I might know where the energy is coming from.{nl}But to get there you need to open a gate, and the mechanism that opens it is being guarded by demons.{nl}
It shouldn't be too hard for you to take them down and get to the gate but...{nl}Like the two Masters, I also wish the people who are under the curse now could finally get some peace.{nl}
I know it won't be easy, but would you go and take care of them first?{nl}You can use the Purifier sheets the Taoist Master gave you.{nl}
There are a few tombstones around here releasing the evil energy.{nl}Stick the Purifiers on the tombstones to keep it from spreading.{nl}
If you use a Purifier, some spirits might try to attack you and get to the sheet.{nl}Make sure to be careful and stay safe.
I really hope we can stop this curse once and for all...
How were the Purifiers, did they work?{nl}
Good. I'm glad we could do something to help those poor people.{nl}But there are others still suffering from this curse. There's one more thing I need you to do.
You might have noticed that some of the demons out there are actually former soldiers who got transformed by the curse.{nl}I would like to save them.{nl}

Use the Exorcist Master's Purifying Holy Water on them to cure them of the curse and release their spirits.{nl}Like the Master said, the curse needs to be taken out of their bodies first, so you may need to make them weaker before using the water.
I hope it works. I just want my former comrades to finally rest in peace.
Thank you. You really saved their souls.{nl}It should be easier for you to get to the gate mechanism now.{nl}
Here's what you need to do to suppress the curse.
Go up through this path until you reach the Meeting Grounds.{nl}There you'll find the mechanism that opens the gate to the Drill Seargent's Lab, where I think the energy is coming from.{nl}
The thing is, to get to the mechanism, you first need to disable the protective barrier around it.{nl}After that you can turn on the mechanism and open the gate.{nl}
Put the Exorcist Master's Goddess Scuplture inside the room, wherever you see the energy coming from.{nl}Unfortunately I don't know how to get rid of the protective barrier, though.{nl}
Also, whoever put this evil energy here in the first place might try to stop us if they figure out what we're doing.{nl}That's as much as I can tell you, I afraid. Sorry I can't help more.{nl}
I feel terrible knowing there's nothing I can do about this. But I still have hope.{nl}Revelator, please. Stop this curse and let this tragedy end once and for all.
I'm really sorry there's nothing else I can do.{nl}But you're the only one who can help us. Please... I beg you.
What happened? Is the energy... gone?{nl}
I see. It sounds like the curse isn't completely over yet.{nl}But I'm glad we brought some peace to those poor souls. Thank you.{nl}
But that means the lab wasn't the source of the curse... Then where is it...?{nl}I need to see the end of this curse with my own eyes, or I'll never be able to rest in peace.{nl}

Until then, I want to do everything I can to stop other spirits from falling into this evil energy.{nl}Seeing your bravery inspires me to do more. It's only right for me to stay here and help in any way I can.{nl}
If you ever find any clues on how we can get rid of this energy, please come back to see me.{nl}Anything at all. I just want to end this curse as soon as possible.{nl}
I pray that your path will always be blessed by the grace of the goddesses.{nl}Thank you again, from the bottom of my heart.
Resistance Adjutant Antanina
Hey, you. Hold right there. Aren't you that Revelator everyone's talking about?{nl}Funny seeing you here, I was just looking for you.{nl}
Did you just roll your eyes at me? Anyway... Oh, I never told you who I was.{nl}My name's Antanina. I'm a detached force adjutant for the Resistance army.{nl}
We received reports of a portal around here that was supposedly made to ambush our forces.{nl}Our goal, of course, is to destroy it.{nl}
Now, we need to be fast and quiet. We were just trying to figure it out when you showed up.{nl}How about you give us a hand? The whole thing will be a lot faster if you do.
Listen. This is all for the good of the Astral Tower.{nl}If the Tower is safe, the whole lake is safe.{nl}
We can bring back the lake's purifying powers.{nl}Then everyone who lives around it will be protected from the demons. Don't you wanna see that happen?{nl}

Also, if we win this, the Schaffenstar gets to work in a much bigger area. That includes us, too.{nl}Think about it. We can finally go beyond the lake and help real people in need, just like what you're doing now.{nl}
Come on, you got nothing to lose here. Huh? Am I right?{nl}This is totally the right thing to do, you know it is. Just come talk to me when you're ready.
Now we're talking!{nl}Alright, let me brief you on it.
The demon portal is being protected by four safety devices.{nl}Did you see any obelisks in the area? Well, those are the portal's safety devices.{nl}
The obelisks are there to collect power and stabilize the portal.{nl}So the first thing we need to do is getting rid of them.{nl}
Once we get rid of the obelisks, then we can destroy the portal. Simple, right?{nl}We don't expect you to take care of everything. We can do half of the obelisks.{nl}
For the portal, we're going to use this tool we got from our superiors.{nl}It's a kind of suppressor. The portal should be pretty weak without the obelisks, so this is gonna finish it off.{nl}
I wrote everything down on this piece of paper.{nl}In case you forget.{nl}
After the obelisks are down, we're going to meet up at the corridor between the Training Grounds and the Reception Room.{nl}Got it? Alright, let's get to it.
Okay, I'm gonna get going now.{nl}Go get the obelisk in the Armory first!
It won't break by force alone. You need to find another way.

There are four obelisks powering the portal.{nl}You can find them at the Armory, Training Grounds, Reception Room and Graveyard.{nl}The Reception Room and Graveyard are further away, so we'll take care of those.{nl}You get the ones at the Armory and Training Grounds.{nl}

Inside the Armory you have different kinds of explosives.{nl}Just take some from the boxes or the barrels there and put them in front of the obelisk.{nl}Then, get a bomb and find a spot from where you can escape. Throw the bomb at the explosives to trigger the first explosion.{nl}All the other explosives should then cause a reaction and tear down the obelisk.{nl}

The obelisk in the Training Grounds is tougher.{nl}You'll see four platforms laid out in front of it.{nl}This obelisk can't be destroyed with explosives like the one in the Armory, so you'll have to use something else.{nl}I tried figuring out a way to take it down, but I came up with nothing so far. You'll have to get there yourself.{nl}

First, try hunting down a few demons and see if you can get any clues.{nl}You should find something related to those platforms.{nl}This obelisk is clearly different from the others, so there could also be a trap in it somewhere.{nl}Just keep that in mind and be careful when you try to destroy it.{nl}I know you can do it. We're all counting on you!{nl}
When you're done taking down both obelisks, come to the corridor between the Training Grounds and the Reception Room.{nl}We'll meet you there.{nl}Good luck.
You're back! Phew, I'm impressed. Guess they don't call you a Revelator for nothing, huh?{nl}Time to take down that portal now.{nl}
Are you ready? We need to look out for any surprise attacks.{nl}Let's take it easy.
I should have been more careful... I can't believe Moringponia was here...{nl}That whirlwind attack was too strong, I couldn't even do anything...!{nl}
But well... at least we can get to the portal now, thanks to you.{nl}You don't know how much this means to us. Thank you, really.
Here, take the Suppressor.{nl}Just put it in front of the portal.{nl}
Our soldiers took a big blow earlier, we're not ready to start moving yet.{nl}You have to be the one to set it up. I'm sorry.
That dirty Moringponia, what kind of attack was that...?!{nl}Nothing we did worked, nothing!! Makes me furious.
You did it. Thank you.{nl}We're finally safe. The Resistance, the Astral Tower, and everyone in the lake.{nl}
We're gonna need a while to get patched up before we start looking into the rest of the demons.{nl}Now that their Lord is gone, we need to know what they're up to.{nl}
As for you... Well, you're the Revelator. Go out and find those Revelations.{nl}If anyone can save this damned world, it's you.{nl}
Be strong, we got your back no matter what.{nl}And uh, make sure to give us a hand again if you ever come back, hehe.
There are demons ahead.{nl}You could become gravely injured. I highly recommend you don't go any further.
The Resistance forces agreed to continue supporting us with material aid.{nl}Soon we will be safe again.{nl}
My only wish is to see our situation stabilized as soon as possible.{nl}Thank you. All of this was possible because of you.
Uhh... The pain... Run... run away...{nl}You can't be here...
You're back! Did you find anything about the curse?{nl}
I see... Well, I'm glad you came to see me again.{nl}You don't have to bring me news every time, you can just come and hang out if you want. It gets... lonely in here.
What? Oh, sorry. Kinda busy here.{nl}If you're looking for the Resistance soldiers, check Barynwell 87 Waters.{nl}They should all be there.
Ugh, I still can't believe I fell for that attack, though.{nl}I used to think I was pretty good with ambush attacks. I guess I was too confident for my own good.{nl}
I'll just have to learn my lesson and straighten up.{nl}But I'm rooting for you. I know you can get us out of this nightmare.
Very well, here's what you need to do.
The platforms in front of the obelisk feel more solid than before.{nl}Maybe the demons around here can give you some clues about it.
Excuse me? Are you saying you saw a man dressed like me?{nl}Where was this?{nl}
Oh... I see. The Resistance... You must be familiar with Commander Byle then.{nl}That is quite a coincidence. I know Byle very well, you see.{nl}
I can tell you more about it later. For now, here's what you should know about this area here.{nl}
Ah, Byle... Yes, the commander of the Resistance army!{nl}Did they take back the Astral Tower, then? Oh, that's wonderful news.{nl}
I am actually very close to Commander Byle, yes.{nl}I can tell you more about it later but, for now, here's what you should know about this area here.{nl}
This is where Commander Byle used to work before he joined the Resistance against the Schaffenstar.{nl}He was always humble and discreet, a very hard-working man.{nl}
One day, he activated a device that was hidden here and got scolded by his superiors for not reporting it right away.{nl}We didn't understand why he did that at the time.{nl}
But then, on Medzio Diena, among all the chaos, this place was left relatively intact.{nl}It had to do with that device that Byle activated.{nl}
Byle didn't leave after he got scolded.{nl}He fought hard to protect this place after that, but Ignas' brutality ended up being too much for him to handle, so he left.{nl}
I was actually really sad about him leaving the Schaffenstar.{nl}We wanted to follow him to the Resistance forces but...{nl}
We couldn't afford to move that far from own forces.{nl}A single soldier could mean the difference between fending off a strike and taking serious damage.{nl}
So we did what we could within the space we had.{nl}Gathering information on the enemy and things like that, I mean. That was... the most we could do.
Huh? So you know who we are?{nl}Then I'm sure you noticed that all we do is for the best, right?{nl}Everything, I mean EVERYTHING the Resistance does is for the good of this lake.{nl}
Huh? So you know who we are?{nl}Then you must know why we're here, right?{nl}Everything the Resistance does is for the good of this lake, you know.{nl}
We received reports of a portal around here that was supposedly made to ambush our forces.{nl}Our goal, of course, is to destroy it.{nl}
Somehow the powers of the lake are no longer activated.{nl}Usually the water of the lake would destroy the demons as soon as they touched it...{nl}No doubt this is all happening because of Ignas.
Kupole Astra
Oh! Revelator, what are you doing here...{nl}
Oh my, I didn't even introduce myself.{nl}My name is Astra, I serve our Goddess Medeina.{nl}
Master Medeina has gone into hiding, you see. I and the other Kupoles are searching for her in the forest.{nl}All the traces lead here but... unfortunately, that's as much as we know.{nl}
Not only that, there seems to be an evil barrier covering Parias Forest.{nl}We worry that Master Medeina has fallen into danger.{nl}
Revelator! Please help us find Master Medeina!
Thank you!{nl}I'm sure we can find her with you on our side! You're the Revelator!
This is where the traces end.{nl}We did look around for other clues, but there was nothing we could find...{nl}
And so the other Kupoles and I decided to split and search for more clues around the forest.{nl}
Would you be so kind as to help with the search?{nl}Just in case I missed any clues around here... Do look again if you can.
Thank you!{nl}You can start with the Spindintis Lot!
Did you look in the Spindintis Lot?{nl}I would like you to check there again, in case I missed anything important.
You heard a song coming from a maple tree?
[Lost butterflies will always wander towards the flowers.]{nl}
What could it mean?{nl}They're only common butterflies...{nl}
Oh! Come to think of it, there is something odd about those butterflies.{nl}
Regular butterflies tend to fly around flowers...{nl}But these butterflies are found only in empty lots of land.{nl}
We should see whether the butterflies react to those flowers you found.{nl}They could be an important clue.
The butterflies' colors could also mean something.
Did you check the butterflies?{nl}If they react to the flowers you found, that could give us a new clue.
Revelator, did you hear the song coming from that tree over there?{nl}
[Beyond the hill is a place the wings of the butterflies reach only in dreams.]{nl}Oh...! I know where the song is leading us!
Down from here is a place called Drugelis Hill.{nl}The name Drugelis comes from the butterflies that live there...{nl}If my intuition is right, I believe we can find another clue there!
This is odd.{nl}There isn't a single butterfly on the hill.
All I see is flowers and trees.{nl}Revelator, I think the leaves you found earlier could be the clue we're looking for...
{nl}Can you see if those flowers will react to your leaves?
The flowers all have different colors.{nl}They must be connected to the colors of the leaves.
How did it go?{nl}Did the flowers react to the leaves?
Oh, I knew it! Master Medeina must have left us these clues herself!{nl}
[Those who guide the butterflies will be blessed by the trees in the shelter of life.]{nl}These lyrics seem to point to the Gyvenimas Shelter.{nl}That's the only shelter in this region.
Hurry, to the Gyvenimas Shelter!
If we let the Tantaliser go like this, we will all be in grave danger.{nl}But there is something we can do!

As I told you when we first met, this forest is surrounded by an evil barrier.{nl}I don't know who could have created it but...{nl}I do know there's a Magic Stone in Grazus Cliff that powers the entire barrier.{nl}
I suggest we use the power of that Magic Stone to tie down the Tantaliser.{nl}That ought to give us time to search for Master Medeina.
I made sure to leave traces behind.{nl}The Tantaliser should come running any moment now.{nl}
The power of the Magic Stone is perfectly sealed. All we need to do is tie down the Tantaliser when she appears.
We did it!{nl}The Tantaliser can't move anymore!
This is our chance to look for more clues!{nl}Hurry, to the Gyvenimas Shelter! That's where the song was leading us!
Let's go, hurry!
Are these... seeds?{nl}Looking at them like this, they do seem to emit a sort of divine energy.{nl}

If these seeds were hidden here by Master Medeina, they must be important.{nl}It will be best if you keep hold of the seeds for now.{nl}If we come to find Master Medeina, you should be the one to give them back to her.{nl}
[Where the longing deer are welcome, the one blessed by the trees awaits you.]{nl}I wonder where this will lead us...{nl}
Oh! The longing deer! It must mean the place where they go to drink!{nl}Beyond the Tesiamas Falls there is a spot called the Mazas Pond!{nl}
The song must be leading us to the pond!{nl}{nl}
Uhh... I can't move.
I'm going to need some time to recover...{nl}Please, carry on to the Mazas Pond.{nl}
The pond is in front of the waterfalls.
There must be another clue at the Mazas Pond.
So Master Medeina was being chased by Kartas.{nl}Oh... I understand now.{nl}
She went into hiding because of us.{nl}To protect us from Kartas...{nl}
If you get to the center of Parias Forest, find a Kupole by the name of Ilona and alert her.{nl}She is also on the search for Master Medeina, she'll be able to help you.{nl}
I will look for more help as soon as I recover.
Is that true?{nl}If Kartas really is really after Master Medeina like you say, we're in serious trouble!{nl}That must mean Kartas was the one to put this evil barrier all around the forest.{nl}
Oh! Yes, I saw a Magic Stone like that at the Poilsis Pond!{nl}
Sealing off the power of the Magic Stone could do something to help Master Medeina.{nl}Would you help me do it?
Thank you!{nl}Let me give you this Sealing Scroll.{nl}
You can use it to seal off the Magic Stone's power, just like you did to the other stone!
The Magic Stone's power is all sealed off now!{nl}That was a close call with all the monsters, I can't believe you took them all down!
There's a firefly, look!{nl}It must be guiding us to where Master Medeina is! We should follow it!
How glad I am to see you arrive safely.{nl}I am Medeina, Goddess of the Forest.{nl}
Never did I imagine that you would find these seeds.{nl}They possess immense power, you see. That is why I hid them where no one else could possibly find them.{nl}
My sister Laima once told that the one carrying these seeds would find their way to me in a time of danger.{nl}That day has now arrived.
As you know, I am hiding from a vicious demon lord by the name of Kartas.{nl}I could not fight him myself, as I was gravely injured by Medzio Diena, and so I hid from him in this forest...

{nl}Alas, he came to know of my whereabouts and produced a barrier to cover the entire region.{nl}These seeds, the ones we call the Seeds of the Divine Tree, have the power to restore my health, allowing me to face Kartas. But that is not possible now.
{nl}I must recover some of my power for the seeds to heal me completely...{nl}But as it is, I can barely stand on my own two feet.{nl}
I understand it is much to ask of you, but will you aid me in my recovery?
Thank you.{nl}The Seed of the Divine Tree possesses regenerative properties.
{nl}First take the seed to a dying plant.{nl}If you do so, the plant will regenerate and absorb part of the seed's powers.
{nl}Collect the revived plant and bring it to me.{nl}I may be unable to use the seeds as they are...{nl}But I believe this plant will help restore some of my health.
You may bring some Dying Grass from near the Parias Falls.
Thank you.{nl}This will help me restore some of my health.
Before I use the Seed of the Divine Tree, there is something I must do.{nl}First, I want to produce a false seed to fool Kartas. Then, I will need to seal away the seed's powers.
{nl}If I attempt this on my own, Kartas might be able to sense my movements.{nl}Therefore I must ask: are you willing to help me?
Thank you.{nl}You must hurry, there is no time to waste.
Please, hurry.{nl}Kartas could find us at any moment.
The preparations are over.
The power held by this Seed of the Divine Tree is far greater than I imagined.{nl}Its regenerative properties are astounding.
{nl}I will use this power to produce a false seed that will fool Kartas.
There are a few young maple trees on the path to Syla Forest.{nl}If you bring the seed to those trees, it will grow them instantly.

{nl}Using the seed to grow one of those trees is a violation of the laws of Nature.{nl}Therefore, as quickly as it grew, the tree will soon perish.{nl}Before the tree dies, you must collect one of its branches and bring it to me.
{nl}Kartas will not know of the Seed of the Divine Tree. Perhaps only vaguely.{nl}If we can disguise the branch, we can fool Kartas into thinking it is important.{nl}
Take a close look on the path to Syla Forest.{nl}There you will find the young maple trees.
You've done it.
The Seeds of the Divine Tree possess extraordinary powers.{nl}Should they fall in the hands of Kartas or any other demon, the results will be catastrophic.
{nl}I would like to seal away the seeds' powers, so that they may be used solely for my restoration.
Long ago, I had altars built at the Paslaptis Lot for this purpose.{nl}Activate the altars starting from the lowest, then place the Seed of the Divine Tree on the last altar.
{nl}The energy contained in the altar will surround the seed and begin to seal away its powers.{nl}
There are multiple altars at the Paslaptis Lot.{nl}I did not want their energy to be compromised.
{nl}You may activate the altars starting from the bottom.
Good, the power of the seeds is sealed safely now.
We're ready.{nl}It's time to restore my health.
{nl}May I have the seeds now?
Aahhh... I put us all in danger.{nl}I just saw him take Master Medeina and I... I'm sorry.
I don't see Ilona.{nl}I need to see what's happening.
There are more demons here than I imagined.{nl}I think we should look for Ilona together.
Let's go look for her!
Thank you, Revelator.{nl}All I've done was delay Master Medeina's rescue...{nl}{nl}I am so ashamed.
But there is something at the center of Parias Forest that Master Medeina left me.{nl}I suppose she wanted me to use it in an emergency like this...{nl}
She gave me one of her orbs and told me to use it whenever I needed to find her.{nl}It was that very orb that brought me to this forest in the first place.{nl}
I could use Master Medeina's orb again to follow her but...{nl}I'm worried that we might end up falling for one of the demons' traps instead.{nl}
Would you help me find Master Medeina with this orb?
You can use the orb to find Master Medeina's traces.
I don't see any more traces.
I think we should go further into the courtyard.{nl}This might be dangerous, but we're already at the end of the path...{nl}
There could be other clues in here.
Let's go inside!
You've come to rescue me.
Kartas is planning to take me to the demon realm.{nl}He has me confined with this Teleportation Magic Circle. I cannot escape.{nl}
If only there was a way to disable this magic circle...

The Support Magic Circles you see here are supplying power to this Teleportation Magic Circle.{nl}If you destroy them, the Teleportation Magic Circle will grow weaker.{nl}Only then can I destroy this barrier with my own power.
I don't believe the Support Magic Circles can be destroyed by force alone, however.{nl}
I would like you to defeat the Red Banterers and bring me their essence.{nl}Should we overload the magic circles with it, we may just be able to destroy them.
Defeat the the Red Banterers and bring me their essence.
Have you got the Red Banterer Essence?
Yes, this should suffice.
You may add the essence to the magic circles.
I was able to destroy the barrier.
The seed did restore my condition somewhat...{nl}But I am still trapped inside the forest barrier.{nl}I believe we need to seal away the Magic Stone that's supplying power to the barrier as well.{nl}
I sense a concentration of magic energy near the Paprastas Lot.{nl}The Magic Stone is likely to be there.{nl}
Revelator, will you seal away the Magic Stone?
Take this Sealing Scroll and place a seal around the Magic Stone.{nl}I will be preparing for my escape in the meantime.{nl}
Good luck.
Was there a Magic Stone at the Paprastas Lot?
Yes, the barrier feels much weaker.
I ought to hurry now.
But my Kupoles...
No. Revelator, you take the seed and abandon the forest immediately.{nl}It's the seed's powers that Kartas covets.{nl}
I must go back. I worry too much for my Kupoles.
I wasted the time that was given to me...{nl}Laima tried to warn me, yet I did not listen.{nl}
She told that Kartas would one day become a threat, that he would seek me.{nl}And that a choice would present itself.
My call to Miss Neringa was far too late... and now Master Medeina is...{nl}Oh, what gruesome fate...
The Mazas Pond is just after the waterfall.
I'm tending to my guns now.{nl}Will you come back later?
{nl}Also, would you step back a little?{nl}I'm not too comfortable with you coming so close.

Saving Lives

You defeated all the monsters. Help the Injured Soldier.
Talk to the Injured Soldier.
Collect Lake Water
Go to the Old Residential Quarters and collect some detoxifying lake water.
You collected the water. Go back to the Injured Soldier and return the Filled Glass Bottle.
Collect Lake Water
Ask for Help
You received a badge from the Injured Soldier. Alert the Recovery Squad and ask for help.
Talk to the Recovery Squad Adjutant
Explain the Injured Soldier's situation.
Talk to the Recovery Squad Adjutant.
The Recovery Squad Adjutant looks worried. Listen to him.
Deliver the Return Orders
Tell the soldiers at the Barynwell Hill Road their orders to return.
The orders have been delivered. Report back to the Recovery Squad Adjutant.
Install the Bombs
Go to the Collapsed Square and install the bombs you received from the Recovery Squad Adjutant.
You finished setting up the bombs. Report back to the Recovery Squad Adjutant.
Lure the Monsters

The Recovery Squad Adjutant left a mark at the Collapsed Square.{nl}Head to the marked spot and wait for the Adjutant to lure the monsters to the bombs. Then, defeat any monsters that survive the explosion.
You have defeated all the monsters. Return to the Recovery Squad Temporary Base and report to the Adjutant.
Destroy the Portal
Head to the Collapsed Square and destroy the monster portal.
You have destroyed the portal. Report back to the Recovery Squad Adjutant.

You have defeated the monster. Talk to Recovery Squad Adjutant.
Return to the Recovery Squad Temporary Base and talk to the Adjutant.

Talk to Brockal Himil.
Repair the Stockades
Prepare for the monsters' attack by repairing the stockades near the Himil Family Base.
The stockades have been repaired. Report back to Brockal Himil.
You need to acquire more food supplies. Go to the Reservoir and catch some fish.
You have caught a good amount of fish. Report back to Brockal Himil.
Go to the Old Training Grounds and defeat the monsters before they start to gather.
You have defeated the monsters. Report back to Brockal Himil.
Defeat the Concentrating Monsters
Morale Boost
Give an encouraging pep talk to the garrisons at the Himil Family Base.
You have encouraged the garrisons. Report back to Brockal Himil.

Find Brockal Himil's student, who is observing the monsters at the Collapsed Shelter.
Talk to Brockal Himil's Apprentice
Talk to Brockal Himil's Apprentice.
In order to defeat their leader, first you need to defeat the monsters near the Maven Intersection.
You have defeated the subordinate monsters. Report back to Brockal Himil's Apprentice.
Head to the alleyway near the Collapsed Observatory and install a bomb to take down nearby monsters.
The bomb has been set up. Repor back to Brockal Himil's Apprentice.
Defeat the Monster Leader
Defeat the leader of the monsters.
You have defeated the monster leader. Talk to Brockal Himil's Apprentice.
Report Back

Report to Brockal Himil about the monster leader.
Talk to the Laker Boy
A boy is pulling some water plants looks at you. Talk to the boy.
Remove the Water Plants
Help the Laker Boy remove the Water Plants growing around the Watch Post.
You have removed enough Water Plants. Report back to the Laker Boy.
Talk to the Laker Boy.
Move the Water Plant Piles

The piles of water plants are too heavy for the boy. Help him move the plants to the Aqueduct Control Room while he starts the shredder.{nl}1. Interact with the Water Plant Piles to pick them up.{nl}- You can carry a maximum of 4 piles at a time.{nl}- The piles can be discarded.{nl}2. Carry the piles to the Aqueduct Control Room.{nl}3. Interact with the device at the aqueduct to drop the piles.
You have moved all the piles of water plants. Talk to the Laker Boy.
Collect Materials
There are too many piles of water plants and the boy doesn't have enough materials to process them. Collect some Magic Sources at the Old Warehouse for him.
You have collected enough Magic Sources. Bring them to the Laker Boy.
The boy wants you to help the Laker Leader who looks after Maven 32 Waters. Find the leader at the Laker Temporary Base and talk to her.
Talk to the Laker Leader
Talk to the Laker Leader.
Collect Poison Arrow Materials
The Laker Leader wants to craft poison arrows in order to defeat a large monster. Go to the Old Stakeout Box and collect some Plants with Lake Energy.
You have collected all the materials for the arrows. Bring them to the Laker Leader.
The Laker Leader wants to make sure the area is clear before handling the giant monster. Defeat monsters near the lot.
You have defeated the monsters. Report back to the Laker Leader.
Defeat the Giant Monster
Find the Laker Leader at the Old Laker Training Grounds and defeat the giant monster together.
You have defeated the monster. Talk to the Laker Leader.
Collect Materials for Self-Defense Weapons
The Laker Leader wants to make new self-defense weapons for her young lakers. Defeat the Frocolis at the Laker Shelter and collect materials for the weapons.
You have collected enough materials. Bring them to the Laker Leader.

Different Circumstances
Tadas from the Kedora Alliance is looking for help at the Outer Wall District 14.

Return to Tadas
Deliver the Topaz Fragments to Tadas.
Talk to Barbarian Wolke

Wolke wants you to clear out the monsters while he is discussing with Tadas.
Talk to Barbarian Wolke in Outer Wall District 14.
Collect Shiny Glass Shards
Head to the Northern Tournament Hall in Outer Wall District 14 with Wolke and collect Shiny Glass Shards from the monsters.
Deliver the Shiny Glass Shards to Tadas.
Talk to Tadas
Talk to Nergui
Nergui from the Kedora Alliance is waiting for you at the Barrack Roof of Outer Wall District 14.
Collect Cornerstone Pieces
Collect Cornerstone Pieces with Nergui at the Weapons Assembly Area in Outer Wall District 14.
Defeat Monsters to Collect Cornerstone Pieces

Deliver the Cornerstone Pieces to Tadas
Collect More %s
Tadas is desperately in need of your help.
Collect Ancient Tree Essence
Tadas wants you to go instead of Wolke and Nergui and collect Ancient Tree Essence from the tree roots.
Deliver the Ancient Tree Essence to Tadas.
Talk to Ineta
Kedora Alliance Ineta is waiting for your help at the Outskirts Bridge in Outer Wall District 15.
Use the Time Meter
Ineta suggests you use the Time Meter Necklace to see the events of Medzio Diena in your current location.
Talk to Kedora Alliance Ineta at the Outskirts Bridge in Outer Wall District 15.
Collect Lever Pieces
Ineta wants you to use the Time Meter at the Grave of the Nameless and collect Lever Pieces.
Collect Broken Statue Pieces
Ineta wants you to use the Time Meter at the Beacon Mound Entrance and collect Broke Statue Pieces.
Collect Broken Wheel Pieces
Ineta wants you to use the Time Meter at the Beacon Mound Entrance and collect Broke Wheel Pieces.
Collect Burnt Arrows
